description: From Ancient Greek θεαρχία (thearkhía), from θεός (theós, “god”) + -αρχία (-arkhía, “rule, ruling”).

entries.meaning: A government ruled by God or a god; a theocracy.
examples: There ends Monarchy as a Thearchie, or divine dynastie.

entries.meaning: A system or ordering of deities. (Compare pantheon.)
examples: From rank to rank in Thearchy divine, We angel raylets gladden in thy sight.
